alert.note: Alert for Central Carbon County; Ferris, Seminoe, Shirley Mountains; Shirley Basin; Southwest Carbon County; Upper North Platte River Basin (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 29 at 6:51PM MST until January 30 at 11:00AM MST by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM MST MONDAY... * WHAT...Snow and dangerously cold wind chills. Additional snowfall accumulations of 1 to 2 inches. Wind chills as low as 25 degrees below zero. * WHERE...Lower elevations of Carbon and Albany counties including Rawlins, Muddy Gap, Shirley Basin, Baggs, and the central Laramie, Ferris, Seminoe, and Shirley Mountains. * WHEN...Until 11 AM MST Monday. * IMPACTS...Hazardous travel conditions due to icy, snow covered roads and significantly reduced visibilities in falling and blowing snow. Dangerously cold wind chills could lead to hypothermia and can cause frostbite on exposed skin in 30 minutes or less.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1. Avoid outside activities if possible. When outside, make sure you wear appropriate clothing, including a knit hat and mittens.

area.areaDesc: Central Carbon County; Ferris, Seminoe, Shirley Mountains; Shirley Basin; Southwest Carbon County; Upper North Platte River Basin
